reviews.review: One of the best games of all time, certainly the best from last year. Sad to hear about Irrational Games going under... but they really outdid themselves with this one.  I highly, highly recommend playing this.
Una obra de arte, el mejor FPS que jugue en vida.

this game, i mean, its so good, like, my nipples got an erection from it.
Best story of 2013!

I can't help but feel like Infinite is Bioshock's less successful cousin. It's got the Shymalan problem: its predecessor executed the late game twist so well, this one feels the need to jerk the narrative around like a bad rollercoaster to compete.

The first Bioshock was a game about destiny, and its climax is one of the more memorable moments in gaming period: "A man chooses; a slave obeys." The second game explored further the codependence of Big Daddies and Little Sisters. It was a protect-the-girl fantasy, but not in a negative way; it was presented within the context of the compulsive bonding and was ultimately simultaneously touching and altogether unnatural.

But, while Infinite is a perfectly serviceable shooter, it fails because it does nothing to innovate. Its story is a mish-mash of story elements that these teams had previously written, and written better. Elizabeth is a sorry example of a protect-the-girl fantasy, at one point literally closing the player's hands around her throat and explaining she'd rather die than be imprisoned again. Clearly, someone thought it was brilliant to give you an in-game travelling companion who mostly wonders how you sleep at night with all that blood on your hands when you aren't actively killing people. Gee, thanks for that.

Infinite's biggest contribution to the franchise, if you will, is that they've taken the lid off the series. There are many doors to cities like Rapture or Columbia, and they're all different and the same. But the game also highlights the weakness in that thought: you've already seen everything they have to offer in the first game. Sure, this time they've put the city in the clouds. But they didn't do anything new with it: this entire game can be item-for-item matched to its predecessors! Maybe 2K does more in the future. Will it be on Mars? Maybe, but apparently, it'll still be the same thing...

I wish I could provide more granularity than simply thumbs up or thumbs down. I'd give Bioshock Infinite something like a C+. It's not BAD, but it's not something I'd recommend over any other game you've got on your wish list.
Its pretty sweet

Wonderfully designed environments, amazing visuals, great story, crap combat. 

Main gripes:
 - The vigors (plasmids) aren't very powerful, so I basically stopped using them. After every battle, the game "helpfully" reminded me to use them... no - sod off.
 - You can only carry 2 guns, meaning you have to choose and have no idea if your choice will be correct until its too late, as unless you've played through once, how would you know?
 - Battles are just waves of enemies that you keep firing at until they stop coming. Not much variety or fun.
 - Auto save was kind of rubbish, the indicator is tiny and vanishes almost immediately, so you often have no idea if your progress is saved or not. I wish game designers would stop insisting on this mechanic or at least give us a way to close the game and resume where we left off.

Worth a punt if it comes up cheap in a Steam sale, but I vastly preferred the original BioShock.

Fazit: Bioshock Infinite
Transfer geglückt! Das „Bioshock“-Rezept aus tollem Shooter, außergewöhnlichem Spiel-Design und einer packenden Geschichte funktioniert auch im neuen Szenario tadellos. Der deutlich angezogene Action-Anteil geht gut von der Hand und erhält durch das Greifhaken-und Portal-Feature zudem eine sinnvolle und spaßige Komponente. Nur das Wegfallen des Rätsel-Anteils ist unverständlich, sorgte der immerhin für zusätzliche Spieltiefe. Auch Horror-Fans müssen zurückstecken. Denn so spannend Columbia auch ist: Eine so dichte wie beklemmende Atmosphäre wie in den Tiefen Raptures finden sie dort nicht. Alles in allem ist „Bioshock“ in seiner neuen Form trotzdem erfrischend wie eh und je – und lässt so viele Genre-Kollegen alt aussehen.

This is the best game I have ever played. The story is emotional, compelling, and very well-written. Visuals are stunning and will blow you away with fine details. The City of Columbia is well-constructed with many interesting aspects. I have absolutely fallen in love with the character of Elizabeth, a video game character that blurs the line between character and human.

The only downside of this game is the gameplay and combat mechanics, seems a little bit dumbed down and simplified from previous BioShock titles. The new skyrail system nonetheless adds a welcomed additional dimension and scale to combat.

Kann ich nur Empfehlen die Storry ist zwar etwas wirr aber das macht dem Spiel nicht so viel aus .Colombia is genau wie schon in den ersten Teilen Rapture eine extrem Lebendige Welt in der man sich frei Bewegen kann aber das besten find ich ich die Verfolgungsfahrten auf der Skyline macht irre Spass .Das Ende fand ich ein bischen entäuschend aber nur weil  Teil 1 und 2 absolute Mastäbe gesetzt haben.

Una de las mejores historias que he visto y jugado hasta ahora. La música y las vistas son geniales, y la mecánica de juego ha mejorado con respecto a sus predecesores (mediante el uso de trajes y el Skyhook). 

Muy pocas veces juego más de una vez un videojuego que ya he terminado, pero jugarlo nuevamente en el modo 1999 no sólo te ayuda a entender una historia ya de por si muy compleja, sino que te hace disfrutarla inmensamente. De verdad recomiendo comprarla.

I've completed all bioshock game series. Each one was as epic and fun as the previous game. Personally, this is one of the games that you had to complete without stopping. Same goes for all bioshock series. Unfortunately it's not possible due to work and sleep and blah blah.

Storyline: I thought it was incredible from the story line to the messages and audio logs. For me, It was one of those games where you beat the game and it leaves you breathless. Each message and audio has a story behind it which was awesome. I like these type of games which makes you think and analyze things. 

Graphics: Very smooth. Nice atmosphere and scenes. Beautiful and dark. I feel like visiting a new country. 

Gameplay: Linear but game is very enjoyable. Very customizable to the abilities that fit your gameplay. One of the best AI sidekicks ever in a game.

Not as good as the original, but still a worthwhile play. As long as you're not comparing it to the first in the trilogy, you'll have a blast. The focus once again is on story and action, but misses the eery horror and madness that surrounds the player in Rapture. I wish the choices you make would influence the ending, which by the is incredibly emotional (and maybe just a tiny bit confusing), and also that there would be a multiplayer. The dlc offers a revisit to Rapture, which is okay from what I hear (don't quote me on that I haven't played it myself.) Overall, a good game that I recommend, so long as you don't make comparisons from vox populi to splicer. 9/10.

結束了"生化奇兵無限"之旅~~
非常令人驚艷的一款大作
無論是遊戲系統，劇情，場景，音樂，人物互動
都做得非常之棒，
詳細優點就不多闡述了，畢竟講不完(雖然我還是很想講XD)

那來說說讓我覺得為數不多 美中不足的缺失吧
身為一款背景為高科技的科幻FPS，敵人和BOSS戰的種類卻沒想像中的多
共8種異能，但敵人似乎只出現兩種異能的兵(火焰和烏鴉)
另外一直期待著能和各種大型機械對抗，場面為之震撼的BOSS戰
甚至最後一戰都覺得略顯單調，突然間就發現，疑~沒了??(我直接玩困難的)

另外一點就是劇情上的矛盾，邏輯不通
劇情上用到了XX世界的概念，不管大家如何的去揣測，總還是有漏洞
這XX世界的概念本來就是很矛盾的東西
除此之外又用到了回到過去與未來的概念

最後
我個人是非常在意劇情上邏輯要通
所以這點倒是給了我一些不好的映像
不過這些缺失完全比不上該作的優點，所以我還是給很高分的評價
或許因為用了這樣複雜的觀念，才能譜出美妙的劇情吧
(第一次看到人物間互動，如此微妙之作)
DLC如果有特價我一定要買XD

Gameplay: Solid, what you'd expect. Builds off of the BioShock gameplay adding skyhooks which are a fun new toy to play with. No complaints here.

Story:
Ass-sniffingly loads of pretentious. While it sorts it self out in the end, It makes no sense in any context. The space-time Rips are largely unexplained (and the one that they give is pretty piss-poor), the 2edgy4me twist at the end was mildly clever, but their way of showing it was not. Booker's Character is an asshole (for no reason whatsoever), Comstock is not a compelling villain, And Daisy Fitzroy murders white children for no reason. The Vox-Populi becomes Black Panther as you, the Aryan superman, fight the evil scourge of the Negro at the end of the game. For this last thing, I'm personally wondering if Ken Levine has a certain "Klan" membership that he's keeping under the radar.

Simply put, Bioshock Infinite is the most graphicaly beautiful game I have ever played. Even for someone like me who sometimes disreguards graphics as a factor in games reviews it has to be talked about here. Artistic design is wonderful and every frame looks like a beautiful nostalgic pin up poster in glorious HD. 

As for the gameplay expect much of the Bioshock of old, Gameplay is polished and refined with some nice new additions but not overhauled completely, this isnt a bad thing though as combat is satisfying and doesnt get too repetative with the addition of Elizabeths tear ability throwing different situations into the mix every time you face the enemy. One negative I have found however is the lack of depth in the vigours, There only seems to be about 8 different ones and the abilitys the grant in combat are all a little samey and a little weak. They seem like an uneccesarry addition but are clearly there as a staple of the franchise, that said it is sad they couldnt had done more to make them seem more worthwhile like in the first two games.

The story too is interesting and exciting, the switch to an airbourne world is a nice change of pace from the spooky underwater themes of the last two games but Infinite doesn't loose the gritty violence and sadistic attitude in its new home. Although at first glance Columbia looks like a friendly and awe inspiring place to live, you soon discover that there is a seedy underbelly to the place. Everyone has been brainwashed into worshiping a dispotic leader, racial segregation is rife and labour laws are lax at best. The revolution is neigh and you've stumbled in at the wrong time...

Overall Bioshock is a fun, exciting and beautiful addition to the series with a setting that I find much more appealing than that of the previous two games. Few story driven FPS's have ever come close to this level of brilliance. 9.5/10

The final game in the Bioshock series(for now at least), ended up being really good but a little short in my opinion. Although I did rush through it a little, I did take the time to get some upgrades and other things, but even then it was still a bit short. However, the story really made it worth it, the characters and dialogue were a bit shocking at first because it's set right after the Revolutionary War(lots of racism, etc.) but you'll get used to it, after all it's just a game and it's trying to immerse you in the world by making it seem real and accurate to the times. Overall, definitely a buy especially with the Bioshock bundles, but it's still a good enough game on its own to buy.

I felt the story was fine and in my opinion i really enjoyed it, i felt the combat was lacking on my first play through (normal mode) but when i beat it in the space of two days i was still on super hype so went and played it on 1999 mode. Playing it again on 1999 mode was great, the combat opened up and was more interesting i also had to apply more tactics to each fight because i was doing the scavanger hunt achievement which was quite fun. So whilst i loved the game i can see why overs might not, or atleast the ones that aren't just jumpig on the band waggon.

I'm quite sure it's a constant, so suffice it to say, I play BioShock Infinite.

I mean, I *play* BioShock Infinite.

Amazing game.  It's actually hard to explain what's so good about it without spoilers, but I think if you were a fan of some the more "existencial philosophy" type episodes of Star Trek, for instance (TNG had a lot of stuff like this), you'll love what it gets up to with the story.
The game mechanics are "basic FPS with a few neat tricks", it's very much a story-driven game - but it's one of those stories where I think you gain a lot and relate to the characters better by "being there" than if it was just a movie.  That said, if you're one of those people who hates games that are like interactive movies you might want to consider more carefully.
Decent graphics and a slightly convoluted story, don't bother with the DLC's, a good way to waste a weekend all in all: 8/10

Одна из лучших игр 2013 года, и с этим спорить трудно. Что же в ней такого примечательного?

1. Сюжет. В первую очередь именно сюжет дает нам главный интерес играть в эту часть Bioshock. Лихо закрученные сюжетные твисты и колоритные персонажи только бездушных оставят равнодушными.
2. Антураж уровней. От красочной Колумбии до настоящего ада в облаках. Интерьер города поражает воображение и еще глубже погружает нас в события игры. Любителям стим-панка и футуризма эта часть явно придется по вкусу.
3. Тактический шутер. Именно тактический, ибо если вы играете в Биошок на сложном уровне или в режиме "1999 год", то весь геймплей состоит из четко продуманной тактики и быстроты действий, что большой плюс.
Единственный минус отмечу, так это кривоватый NPC, но не все так страшно.

Вредикт выношу такой: 9,5/10
Рекомендую. BioShock Infinite оставляет только хорошие впечатления :)
